## Syntax highlighting

Here is a sample code chunk, just to show that syntax highlighting works as expected.

```{r sh, echo=TRUE, eval=TRUE}
not_null <- function (v) {
  if (!is.null(v)) return(paste(v, "not null"))
}
```

```{r, echo=TRUE}
iris %>%
  filter(Species == "setosa") %>%
  head()
```

# Tables

Here is a sample table output.

```{r irismeans}
tab <- iris %>%
  group_by(Species) %>%
  summarise_all(.funs = mean)
kable(tab,
  caption = "Species-specific mean lengths and widths.")
```


# Figures

## Base graphics

A base graphics histogram:

```{r basehist, fig.cap="A Histogram made with the basic graphics package"}
hist(rnorm(100))
```

## ggplot2

Same with `ggplot2` :

```{r gghist, fig.cap="A ggplot2 histogram"}
d <- data.frame(x=rnorm(100))
ggplot(data=d) + geom_histogram(aes(x=x), bins = 30)
```
